BeamMomentum.cc

00001 #include "BeamMomentum.hh"
00002 
00003 #include <vector>
00004 #include <cmath>
00005 #include <iostream>
00006 
00007 
00008 namespace CALICE {
00009 
00010   BeamMomentum::BeamMomentum(const CALICE::BmlSlowRunDataBlock& cernBeamData) {
00011     std::vector<double> bendMagnets =  cernBeamData.getBendCurrents();
00012     std::vector<double> collimators =  cernBeamData.getCollimatorPositions();
00013 
00014     //  std::cout << bendMagnets.size() << std::endl;
00015     //  std::cout << collimators.size() << std::endl;
00016 
00017     // size check
00018     if (bendMagnets.size() != 9*2) {
00019       throw new BeamMomentumException("CERN beamline expects 9 bend magnets");
00020     }
00021     if (collimators.size() != 11*4) {
00022       throw new BeamMomentumException("CERN beamline expects 11 collimators");
00023     }
00024 
00025 
00026     /*
00027      * Prepare variables that follow the numbering scheme of the beam documents.
00028      * If the read value is 0, try the set value.
00029      * For the collimators this might be overdone, as only 3 & 8 are of interest, but let's stay general.
00030      */
00031     std::vector<double> B;
00032     std::vector<double> C;
00033 
00034     B.resize((bendMagnets.size()/2)+1);
00035     for (unsigned int i=0; i< bendMagnets.size(); i+=2) {
00036       int I = i/2+1;
00037       if (I == 8 ) continue; // BEND8 does not exist
00038       if (bendMagnets[i] !=0 )  B[I] = bendMagnets[i];
00039       else {
00040         B[I] = bendMagnets[i+1];
00041         _warningText << "Bend" << I << " actual value is 0 - reading error? --> using set value instead" << std::endl;
00042       }
00043       if ( bendMagnets[i+1] != 0 &&
00044            fabs((bendMagnets[i] - bendMagnets[i+1])/bendMagnets[i+1]) > 0.01 )
00045         _warningText << "Bend"<< I <<" actual value " << bendMagnets[i]<< " but ref " << bendMagnets[i+1] << std::endl;
00046     }
00047 
00048     C.resize((collimators.size()/4)+1);
00049     for (unsigned int i=0; i< collimators.size(); i+=4) {
00050       int I = i/4+1;
00051       if ( I == 4 || I == 7 ) continue; // COLLIMATOR 4 & 7 do not exist
00052       if (collimators[i] != 0 && collimators[i+2] != 0 )  C[I] = collimators[i+2] - collimators[i];
00053       else {
00054         C[I] = collimators[i+3] - collimators[i+1];
00055         _warningText << "Collimator" << I <<" has 0 value (" << collimators[i] << "," << collimators[i+2] <<")" << std::endl;
00056       }
00057       if ( collimators[i+1] !=0 &&
00058            collimators[i+3] !=0 &&
00059            ( fabs((collimators[i] - collimators[i+1])/collimators[i+1]) > 0.1 ||
00060              fabs((collimators[i+2] - collimators[i+3])/collimators[i+3]) > 0.1 ) )
00061         _warningText << "Collimator"<<I<<" actual value (" << collimators[i] << "," << collimators[i+2] <<") but ref "<< collimators[i+1] << "," << collimators[i+3] << std::endl;
00062     }
00063 
00064     _momentum = B[5]/-4.72;  // official momentum defining bend
00065 
00066     /*
00067      * To reduce problems with failed readouts of single magnets
00068      * only magnets with more than 3GeV are accounted.
00069      * This should be save, as the minimum energy of the beamline is 6 GeV.
00070      */
00071     _secondaryMomentum = 0;
00072     int goodMagnets = 0;
00073     if ( fabs(B[2]/7.25) > 3 ) {
00074       _secondaryMomentum += B[2]/7.25;
00075       goodMagnets++;
00076     }
00077     if ( fabs(B[3]/-4.7) > 3 ) {
00078       _secondaryMomentum += B[3]/-4.7;
00079       goodMagnets++;
00080     }
00081     if ( fabs(B[4]/4.84) > 3 ) {
00082       _secondaryMomentum += B[4]/4.84;
00083       goodMagnets++;
00084     }
00085     _secondaryMomentum /= (double)goodMagnets;
00086 
00087 
00088     _tertiaryMomentum = 0;
00089     goodMagnets = 0;
00090     if ( fabs(B[5]/-4.72) > 3 ) {
00091       _tertiaryMomentum += B[5]/-4.72;
00092       goodMagnets++;
00093     }
00094     if ( fabs(B[6]/4.95) > 3 ) {
00095       _tertiaryMomentum += B[6]/4.95;
00096       goodMagnets++;
00097     }
00098     if ( fabs(B[7]/5.02) > 3 ) {
00099       _tertiaryMomentum += B[7]/5.02;
00100       goodMagnets++;
00101     }
00102     _tertiaryMomentum /= (double)goodMagnets;
00103     _relativeSpread = sqrt(pow(C[3],2.) + pow(C[8],2.))/19.4/100. / (2.*sqrt(2.*log(2.)));
00104 
00105     if ( fabs((_secondaryMomentum - _tertiaryMomentum)/_tertiaryMomentum ) < 0.1 && C[8] > 4.) {
00106       _limitedRelativeSpread = sqrt(pow(C[3],2.) + pow(4.,2.))/19.4/100. / (2.*sqrt(2.*log(2.)));
00107       _warningText << "This looks like secondary beam (p_{ter}=" << _tertiaryMomentum << " p_{sec}=" << _secondaryMomentum << ") and C8 = "<< C[8] <<" > 4mm " <<std::endl
00108                    << "Relative spread might be overestimated." << std::endl
00109                    << " alternative relative spread: " << _limitedRelativeSpread << std::endl;
00110 
00111     }
00112     else _limitedRelativeSpread = _relativeSpread;
00113 
00114 
00115   }
00116 
00117   double BeamMomentum::getMomentum() const {
00118     return _momentum;
00119   }
00120 
00121   double BeamMomentum::getSecondaryMomentum() const {
00122     return _secondaryMomentum;
00123   }
00124 
00125   double BeamMomentum::getTertiaryMomentum() const {
00126     return _tertiaryMomentum;
00127   }
00128 
00129   double BeamMomentum::getRelativeSpread() const {
00130     return _relativeSpread;
00131   }
00132 
00133   double BeamMomentum::getMomentumSpread() const {
00134     return _relativeSpread*_momentum;
00135   }
00136 
00137   double BeamMomentum::getLimitedRelativeSpread() const {
00138     return _relativeSpread;
00139   }
00140 
00141   double BeamMomentum::getLimitedMomentumSpread() const {
00142     return _limitedRelativeSpread*_momentum;
00143   }
00144 
00145   const std::string BeamMomentum::getWarnings() const {
00146     return _warningText.str();
00147   }
00148 }
